Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of reclining, nude Harpocrates. Mould-made and hollow. White coating traces. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

3rd century BC parallel (Fischer 1994, no.281), mid 2nd century BC parallel from Memphis (Bayer Niemeier 1988, no21). Also see finer late 4th to 3rd century BC example from Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, no. 3). Bayer Niemeier , E. 1988, Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann / Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik Frankfurt am Main I. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten, Melsungen. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.Wasmuth. Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie: figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo: Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.046) (Phase 3)
